letter_description: always spoken at the beginning of words with vocal anlaut
nikud_description: Looks like a 'T' and can be found under the letter, makes a short 'u' sound (as in sun)

letter_description: always spoken at the beginning of words with vocal anlaut
nikud_description: Looks like a flat horizontal line under the letter and makes an 'ah' sound (as in darn)

letter_description: always spoken at the beginning of words with vocal anlaut
nikud_description: Two side-by-side dots under the letter, makes a long 'a' sound (as in say)

letter_description: always spoken at the beginning of words with vocal anlaut
nikud_description: Three dots arranged as an inverted pyramid under the letter, makes a short 'e' sound (as in red)

letter_description: always spoken at the beginning of words with vocal anlaut
nikud_description: Two dots stacked below the letter, can either have no sound at all (this is called a sheva nach) or it can make a quick 'ih' sound, as in lick (in which case it is called a sheva na)

letter_description: always spoken at the beginning of words with vocal anlaut
nikud_description: Can either make a long 'o' sound (as in lone), or among some Ashkenazim it makes an 'oy' (as in toy).

Makes an 'oo' sound (like boot) and appears like a vav with a dot to its left
A single dot below the letter, makes a long 'e' sound when followed by a yud. Otherwise it makes a short 'i' sound
Makes a shorter 'oo' sound like in 'book' and appears like three dots, arranged like an ascending staircase below the letter

letter_description: t as in tool or th as in thought
nikud_description: Looks like a 'T' and can be found under the letter, makes a short 'u' sound (as in sun)

letter_description: t as in tool or th as in thought
nikud_description: Looks like a flat horizontal line under the letter and makes an 'ah' sound (as in darn)

letter_description: t as in tool or th as in thought
nikud_description: Two side-by-side dots under the letter, makes a long 'a' sound (as in say)

letter_description: t as in tool or th as in thought
nikud_description: Three dots arranged as an inverted pyramid under the letter, makes a short 'e' sound (as in red)

letter_description: t as in tool or th as in thought
nikud_description: Two dots stacked below the letter, can either have no sound at all (this is called a sheva nach) or it can make a quick 'ih' sound, as in lick (in which case it is called a sheva na)
